event.summary: 03/11/1993: Muslim militants killed a traffic police man and wounded another police man in Sohag, midway between Cairo and Aswan.
event.motive: The attack may have been in retaliation for a government raid on fundamentalists the day before.
event.addnotes: Police raids on Tuesday night and Wednesday resulted in the death of 14 extremists, a militant's wife and her baby and four police officers. More than 40 people were wounded. The attack on police may have been retaliation for the police raids. One injury and one casualty resulted from the attack on the police.
event.scite1: “Egyptian Officer Dies; Radicals Are Blamed,” The New York Times, March 12, 1993.
event.scite2: Zina Hemady, “Muslim Extremists Strike Back at Police Crackdown in Egypt,” The Associated Press, March 11, 1993.
